the BlurFilter now supports stronger blurs with fewer passes

The previous technique (using the bilinear texture sampler to double the number of lookups) is now only used for the final pass.
All other passes now simply use a standard gauss distribution (5 lookups) with offsets that double in each step.
That way, the blurriness quickly gets much higher, with fewer render passes.

Thanks to Bernhard Pichler from "StageXL" for the suggestion about the doubling offsets!

now updating cached texture base when MeshStyle is copied

The cached base reference is only used to find out if a mesh can be batched with another one.
When the texture is restored after a context loss, the base changes, but the reference is not updated.
This breaks batching, but doesn't cause any other rendering issues.

Ideally, the reference should be updated when the base texture changes, but there is no such mechanism yet.
Instead, I'm now simply updating it in the `copyFrom` method, since that is called regularly (without being overly expensive).
For the time being, this should do the trick.

Fixed argument check of BitmapFont constructor
Update BitmapFont.as

More data consistency The "texture" is a through-constructor initialized immutable field. The case of which the two arguments are null is the "default" approach to utilize the "minimal" embedded font, and the "typical" case is when the two arguments are provided correctly. * When drawing filters, only the last step needs to be cached. The process was a hack before, requiring to reverse the position inside the render cache and temporarily setting the frameID to zero.

replaced 'RenderUtil' with 'Painter' and 'RenderState'; added 'Pool' for basic object pooling

Over time, the old "RenderUtil" class had grown in size and had become rather confusing to use. The new setup is much cleaner: it splits up the code in two parts:

* a "RenderState" containing properties that are frequently changed, most importantly the render matrices and context settings.
* a "Painter" for general drawing operations, and for managing the state (using a stack). The stack makes it possible to write render code without the fear of side effects.

Furthermore, the Painter is publicly accessibly via a property on the Starling class  acting as a logical partner of the "Juggler" (the juggler animates, the painter draws). That way, you can access (and change!) the current render state even outside the render loop, e.g. when drawing to textures.
